title: Tencent Sells Roughly $3 Billion of Its Stake in Singaporeâ€™s Sea
sub_head: Chinese internet giant retains 19% share of the e-commerce and videogame company, whose value has surged in recent years
body:
Tencent Holdings Ltd. has cut its stake in a Singaporean internet company, shedding an ownership position that was worth about $3 billion.
Tencent, one of the biggest Chinese internet businesses, said it is selling about 14.5 million shares of Sea Ltd., a company that runs an e-commerce platform, makes digital games and offers online financial services. U.S.-traded shares of Sea had closed on Monday at $223.31 apiece.
